Reviews.Title: I like it , but it's been a complicated relationship.....
Reviews.Author: backofthebusgirl
Reviews.Content: When I first activated the phone, calling worked, but texting didn't.  I made one call, and then calling didn't work, either.  I tried everything, including trying customer service (Prepare to be frustrated beyond belief--it's all automated B.S. that requires you to press numbers, and it doesn't always recognize your touch tones.  ARG!)  I decided to try the "reset" option in settings, and then the phone decided that it was a verizon phone.  (WTF???)  filed two help tickets with tech support, and finally after a LOT of time and hassle, managed to get the phone reset on THEIR end, and now it works.Very pleased with the camera capabilities--it essentially has turbo-photoshop in it, so if you like playing with photos, you will like this.  I have not tried videos yet.While on the phone, I have had problems--I hear a beep and my call is gone--not sure what that is about--I make sure to keep the screen away from my face, so I can't believe I am "ending call" with my face.  I don't know how it happens.Sometimes, I am unable to get the touch screen to respond when I want to go to a different screen.  I tap, and it ignores me.  I'm hoping that this is mostly "pilot error" and that I will get better at it.

Reviews.Title: Decent Android Phone
Reviews.Author: Living Life In The Midwest
Reviews.Content: ******* Update March 22, 2014 *********Now that the price is half of a Franklin bill I have moved the product to 5 stars.***************************************Opening Remarks (review is below):First I must say cell phones are not new to me. I worked in the cell phone industry and that is why I use pre-paid service. That is all I am going to say about that and I will not respond to questions about that subject.Pre-paid is just a way to separate money from people who don't want to commit, can't commit or want the option to quit when things turn against their favor. With pre-paid you get cut-rate service at a cut-rate price. Those not familiar with pre-paid should know that when you call customer service you will not get a call center that is in the USA.Pre-paid companies were started by the big name cell companies as a way to sell service to everyone, pre-paid companies will cut corners with service to keep their costs low. With Tracfone I suggest creating an online account with them on their official website. From there you can activate new phones, register the phones to your account and transfer your numbers and minutes to new phones you buy without having to call tim-buck-too and speaking with someone that does not understand you very well. Try to do as much as your own problem solving and customer service as you can though their website to avoid their frustrating customer service reps.Review:This phone is Android yes: Cut-rate Android. It is limited to 3G speed for Data on the cell network. If you are expecting state of the art you had best go straight to the service providers like Sprint or Verizon and buy a phone there. There is a wall charger and usb cable included. The usb cable can be connected to the wall charger and phone to charge the phone or the phone and computer to charge the phone or transfer files like mp3 music to the phone.It has a single core 1ghz processor. It is not fast enough to run fast paced games or even multi-task.The GPS works fine, but slow, with the Google Maps app. A little slow to update changes and position at first but I don't know if this is due to the 3G data speed or the single core processor. It became more responsive as my trip went on. I only tested it once in a Midwestern area with no tall buildings.The Wi-Fi is fast and responsive with impressive range. It will also alert you by chime when you are in a free (unsecured) Wi-Fi area. Be very wary of using unsecured Wi-Fi as man in the middle (where you passwords and user names are recorded) attacks can happen.On mine, it has Internal Storage (for apps and user data) of 2.34GB available to use while a tiny bit is already used from the factory. The task manager app shows 386.31 MB of total RAM, just running factory installed apps I have 114 MB free. Again those familiar with Android know that 512 MB of RAM is pretty much the minimum you would want on a device that will run more than one app at a time with 1 GB or more becoming standard on top shelf phones.This phone comes with an SD card. Mine came with a Toshiba 4 GB class 4 card. The SD card can be used to as additional storage for ringtones, video files, etc. This ZTE Valet allows moving apps to an SD card from Internal Storage. Those familiar with android know some apps can be moved from Internal Storage to SD cards if the programmers of the app allow this and only if it is a program that does not automatically run on startup like the Facebook App, Twitter App or Outlook App do.The camera is low end 3MP. It requires a high amount of light to get photos that are not grainy. Indoors photos looked grainy no matter what I did except for when the subject was lit well from sunlight through a window. The camera is somewhat slow to respond, I don't know if this is because of the camera app or the single core processor. I have seen slower cameras on I-phones and top end Android phones though so all in all it isn't the slowest to respond. When I held the phone really still until I was positive the picture has taken the images had the best results. The camera features a flash but no "automatic flash" option. If I want the flash to be used I have to manually turn it on. It is also not a traditional flash but simply a white LED light that illuminates the subject, at close range only, when the shutter button is pressed and continues until the photo is completely taken. In complete darkness the flash had a maximum usable range of 5 feet for me and at that distance only illuminated the center of the photo. The images of faces taken with the flash on looked white washed.A top feature I have not seen before was an option to turn the Data (3g) on and off using the Power Control widget. A one click simple solution that makes this phone the ONLY pre-paid Android to consider. The Power Control Widget on my phone was installed on the first left screen. For those not familiar with Android, swiping my finger from left to right on the home screen reveals this screen. I removed the Android Tips widget from the home screen and moved the Power Control to the home screen to more easily use this option. This option turns off the phones ability to send and receive data over the 3g network thereby stopping any data usage when not on Wi-Fi. Of course you have the option to also turn Wi-Fi off with this widget too.This is a feature sadly lacking in other cell phone companies, so much so that people resort to putting their phone in Airplane mode (all data flow and calls are stopped) when apps like email, twitter and facebook start using too much of their Data plan. I've gotta give it up to Tracfone for this feature. A+ on this! So, if you leave  Data in the off position in the Power Control and only turn it on when you want updates on you accounts (email, twitter, facebook etc.) you can minimize how much data you use. Again I cannot stress how useful this feature is. If you are coming from another pre-paid or traditional cell phone company you may have found yourself exceeding your data plan when your phone was updating your accounts around the clock. On other phones it was possible to positively turn off your data for most apps by turning off Sync but this was often overridden by some apps and also stopped updates from coming through on Wi-Fi.Voice calls are fairly clear with a little bit of an "overdrive" or clipping on louder setting. The rear facing single internal speaker produces loud and relatively distortion free rings and music. It is however somewhat easy to block the speaker when placing it down on its back cover (like you normally would) especially on softer surfaces like seat cushions.The issue of "Minutes": Those familiar with Tracfone know that most newer standard phones give the buyer triple minutes. That is if you buy a 60 Minute card you get that tripled to 180 Minutes. Text messages on these phone were billed at .3 and more rarely .5 minutes per text.I have only bought my minutes for my ZTE Valet online via the Tracfone website and this is what I can tell you from that transaction. My 60 Minute card got me 180 Minutes of talk, 180 Text messages (incoming and outgoing) and 180 Mb of 3g Data.I cannot give 5 stars to this product because its single core processor, its small amount of RAM and its current price (as of October 14th 2013). Virgin Moble pre-paid (a Sprint company), StraightTalk (a Tracfone and Walmart company) as well as Net 10 pre-paid (a Tracfone company) currently have Android phones with similar tech specs for under $50. Virgin has a $35 a month plan for Android with 300 minutes of talk and "unlimited data" a month, StraightTalk has a $45 "unlimited everything" a month plan and Net 10 has $50 "unlimited everything" a month plan.I did not deduct any stars for the new Minute/Texting pricing model. This phone is not using GSM carriers like previous Tracfones and instead is activated using CDMA carriers. CDMA carriers play by a whole different set of rules than GSM carriers and Tracfone has no control of that. I am almost sure they are the ones moving Tracfone to this different pricing model for Android on the ZTE Valet.Final thoughts:There is not Minute bank display on this or any Android on Tracfone. You must open a web browser like Chrome (via Wi-Fi or 3g) and go to: mobile.tracfone.com You will be asked to enter your phone number. You do not need your serial number. You will, after about 45 seconds, get a text message that does not seem to count against your text balance, giving you your remaining Minutes, Texts and Data. Of course if you are on 3g and not Wi-Fi this counts against your data balance. Don't forget to close your browser and turn of your Data on the Power Control widget when you are done with this or you it will continue to use 3g and it will count against your data balance if not on Wi-Fi. I have even been able to access this website on my home computer and receive the text message on my phone, thereby not using any data on my phone.Also install Norton Security from the Google Play store. This app is currently free for its basic mode and works very well. It works better with a Norton account (access to one additional feature) and the Norton company says it even works better in the paid version but I have not tried.If you are giving this phone to a child Install and configure Norton Family parental control. It will block websites based on your childs age and send you an email when they try to access websites that Norton deems inappropriate. I have not used this on the ZTE Valet but do have it installed on my children's Android tablets and fine it does quite well.~~~~~~UPDATE October 21st 2013~~~~~~~~~This is a review with the intention of helping others make a decision based on my experience with the phone and my experience with a great many cell phones from working in the industry. This review is in no way intended to belittle tracfone users as a small number of people may think.Battery life is astonishing with the ZTE Valet when I have the 3g Data turned off. The battery is lasting at least 3 days 2 nights on standby, with wi-fi on, only a few minutes of voice calls, 3g Data turned off and about 10 texts per day (with some apps installed)! I would typically see standard battery capacity Androids getting around 28 hours of standby with the same apps installed but with the 3g data on (because on those phones it can't be turned off).The apps I have installed are: Outlook, Facebook, Google Calendar, Astro File Manager, Chrome, Easy Reminder, Alarm Clock Extreme, K9 email and Norton Mobile Security. All apps work flawlessly. I have set my polls and updates for these programs to 1 or two hour intervals and disable Email Push.I have had no random reboots or lockups. This is pleasant as even name brand phones of the lower end spectrum are susceptible to this.Cases for the ZTE Fury and ZTE Director are supposed to work with this phone. The case I got for a ZTE Fury fits perfectly.Voice dialing has never, ever gotten my numbers correct, even in total silent surroundings. My last Android phone had an almost perfect record for dialing correctly. I am referring to number dialing where I speak the numbers I want my phone to call. Voice commands rely on a fast processor so I am wondering if this single core processor isn't the problem there. However voice dialing has always been perfect when I say the name of the person I want to call, eg "call home".Google voice to text is also affected by the slow processor sometimes simply refusing to work or being so far behind what I am saying it just skips entire groups of words or sentences.Google contacts and calendars sync by default if you enter your Google account when setting up this phone or add it later through the settings>accounts menu.Microsoft calendars sync into the ZTE calendar app or the Google calendar app though the Outlook app. You can also sync your Microsoft contacts through Outlook and see them in the Android contact app but not edit them. I have written many articles on work arounds for this that basically tell the user to set the Outlook app to only sync the calendar and then add your Microsoft account as a Corporate account and set that account to only sync your contacts. You can then edit your Microsoft contacts through the Android contact app. This also works fine on the ZTE Valet.Youtube videos play fine over my home wireless internet connection. No lag or drops. I have not transferred video files to the device to play so I can't speak to the ability to view those videos.I disabled Google Handouts/Talk, Google +, Google Magazines, Google Books, GMail and Google Movies without any problems or adverse affects to the phone. This is an "expert" tweak that probably isn't even necessary.Last for my update the price is dropped by $10 since I bought mine. This brings the phone more in line to what I think it should cost. If it dropped another $10 I would say this is 5 stars far and away one of the best deals.~~~~~~UPDATE October 27th 2013~~~~~~~~~The data cable is standard usb 2.0 (1.0) size and the phone end is USB B micro This is the style they have used for the last few years on most, but not all phones and tablets. It is slightly smaller and distinguishable by its two small spring back prongs that help secure it into the phone. So if you have a 1 amp or higher charger with this end, you can use it.While waiting almost two weeks for my screen protector to come the screen somehow got scratched with a brushing type of scratch. Again (not trying to insult anyone here) but with cut rate phones they use plastic screens that scratch more easily than gorilla glass screens or scratch resistant screens. Be sure to buy a screen protector. I bought one for the ZTE Fury and it fit fine.By uninstalling and re installing the Easy Reminder app two times with restarts in between I have gotten it to work perfectly. At its current price as of October 27th 2013 I give it 4.5 stars. I don't think you can get a much better phone than this for Tracfone even in the Samsung for Tracfone.I am a very happy customer with this phone.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: twf2nd
Reviews.Content: Seeing that I purchase a new phone about every 6 months because some of the tracfones are just all out garbage, but this phone which I got on Amazon for 30 bucks less than what it sells at the Tracfone website, seems to and probably will last a couple of years. Believe me, I'm tired of spending money for phones that last a few months. This phone isjust as good as the more popular brand names and basically does the same things. I am very pleased and will continue to purchase Tracfone phones in the future. Also, get the monthly plan for 24 bucks a month, it is a worry free investment because this phone doesn't display the remaining minutes. 5 STARS!!

Reviews.Title: Insecure because of the Heartbleed bug
Reviews.Author: secdroid
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the phone until the Heartbleed bug was announced.  Therefore, I can not use the phone for secure (https) websites like banking, Gmail, or Amazon.  I knew that the specs and Android version (4.1.1) were not the latest, but it met my needs.  Quality seems fine.  However, neither the carrier (Tracfone) nor ZTE has been willing to address the Heartbleed bug.  All I get is the runaround.  If the bug is fixed, I would rate the phone as 3-4 stars, as long as the user is realistic about the specifications.  I hope a fix is announced.[Edit: added]I want to give five stars to Marketplace vendor "shopcelldeals."  I've always had excellent luck with them.  Very good prices and extremely fast shipping.  I also considered the phone/minutes deal as a five star value.  If only Tracfone/ZTE would fix the bug...

Reviews.Title: The "Heartbleed" Virus Affects this phone...
Reviews.Author: Objective
Reviews.Content: From a recent news article about the "Heartbleed Bug"..."While Google said in a blog post on April 9 that all versions of Android are immune to the flaw, it added that the “limited exception” was one version dubbed 4.1.1, which was released in 2012."This phone uses 4.1.1.  That is a problem.

Reviews.Title: ZTE Valet Great First Smartphone
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: This is an upgrade from my old Samsung SG390 also from Tracfone.(I have had contract phones in the past) So far I haven't had any issues with it other than it dings everytime it does something, when it detects wifi or when it doesn't when it updates something. It's a little annoying. But overall it does work well, so far. I have had it out in the middle of nowhere and it still makes and receives calls, I have downloaded a few apps and they work for what I do and the wifi is as weak as everyone has mentioned I can only get about 20ft away from my router. This is an entry level Android not one of the $500.00 phones with a 2yr contract and a $100.00 a month bill so don't go crazy with apps because it can't handle them. But if you are looking to get out of the rat race and the high bills of the contract phones this is the way to go. If you are a long time Tracfone user, the way the minutes are divided is weird. You get a 200 min card but with the triple minutes you get 600 talk 600 text and 600 mg data instead of one pool of minutes. If you are a heavy texter you get dinged per text from your pool of texts not the .3 minutes like the old phones.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: E. G. Natale "tech wannabe"
Reviews.Content: I finally took the leap into android territory with this smart phone and I am very pleased. I chose it after reading reviews on Amazon which helped to inform me of ways to work with this phone. I barely use any data choosing instead to use wifi at home and free wifi when available while I'm out. Oh... and I am also loving playing Words with Friends on it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone
Reviews.Author: Andrew Bradt
Reviews.Content: Very nice phone.Touch screen is responsive and bright.All apps work quickly and easily.The battery seemed to drain quickly until i downloaded battery doctor which is free from the google play store.Now on it's third day and is at 63%.The only thing i didn't like is the charger port has no cover over it making it easy to get little bits of dirt or moisture in there.Not sure why the negative wifi reviews as mine picked up 3 of my neighbors wifi network signals from a basement bedroom.All in all a very good entry level smartfone.

Reviews.Title: Best value in tracfones ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: Just the phone will cost you $100 in the store.  Look up the cost of the  200 minute card, and that is worth $35 (at least).  Then add the value of triple minutes, the value of an android phone, the value of texts (which used to count as minutes), and the value of the internet on a phone, and you cannot match this value for the money anywhere else.  I have ordered a second one to use as a spare.

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: Same phone from tracfone was $99. Got this phone for less than $75. Amazingly enough, it came with a phone card which put 600 min talk, 600 text messages, and 600 mb data. This was a retail value of $43. Had wanted a smart phone for a long time, but couldn't afford other company's rates. Exactly what I'd been looking for.

Reviews.Title: Low cost Android Phone
Reviews.Author: Andrew G. Lesko
Reviews.Content: A low cost Android phone that does everything i needed and more apps , gps , and internet , plus phone .

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: wes
Reviews.Content: Good phone. It just gets a little slow after you open several apps, so I just restart it n it works better. Also, you have to turn the data on to send multimedia messages

Reviews.Title: GREAT SERVICE - PRICE- PHONE
Reviews.Author: Marl
Reviews.Content: Awesome service. Got the phone in two days. Phone works great in an area where there is no T-Mobile coverage.. The price is so good I am going to order another one and say goodbye to T-Mobile.

Reviews.Title: Android Prepaid Phone is for people who do not want a two years contracts.
Reviews.Author: Jaime T. Kwan
Reviews.Content: Good price and no contract. It is easy to use.  I would like to recommend to people who want to own an Android phone and do not want to pay the high price.  this is the product.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Neotoma
Reviews.Content: So far I am pleased with this phone. This is an upgrade from a Lg800g. A little bit of a learning curve as this is my first smart phone. The reception is excellent and significantly better than my Lg800g phone ever was. The WiFi reception is good but not as good as a lap top. The only thing I like better on my previous phones was the way text messages were displayed by order received.  I dislike the new messages building on previous messages from the same contact. Overall I am pleased with the phone and would recommend as a good first upgrade to a smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: ShaDonna S.
Reviews.Content: The phone is great n we r getting great use out of it. Luv the free minutes that came wit it too...

Reviews.Title: Good value!
Reviews.Author: Charity Herzig
Reviews.Content: Very good on value and works well for a first time android user like me or someone who is not too technical.  The only issues I have had, is sometimes it freezes and I just have to to take out the battery and put it back in, have had it approx. a month and has happened twice.  I successfully use Twitter, facebook, instagram, snapchat, check my email and lots more!  I am happy with the phone so far.

Reviews.Title: decent basic smart phone
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: Isn't the latest greatest smart phone, but as my first smart phone it is working great so far....and assuming I continue my current usage pattern, will cost me less than $10 a month.  Was worried about the WiFi strength from earlier reviews but it works OK in my house and at work.  I did find an area south east of Omaha where I had no phone service (matched pretty well with the coverage map on the Tracfone website, so make sure you look to see where you plan to mostly use it to verify that you will have coverage.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone - Love it!
Reviews.Author: Linda32118
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone and a great value.  It was easy to set up and easy to transfer my existing Tracfone account to.  Only negative that I have sound so far is that the Wi-Fi is a little weak.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Lin
Reviews.Content: Considering that a Tracfone 200 minutes + triple minutes card is approximately $25 - $30, this phone by itself probably costs around $33 when purchased as part of the 600 minute package offered by this seller on Amazon. Where else can you get a full-featured Android phone for $33?  Sure, the Valet's performance doesn't measure up to the latest Samsung and Apple phones, but those cost just a "little bit" more than $35.  If you are on a budget and need a smartphone, this phone just can't be beat.Setup was fast and easy.  I had a basic Tracfone flip-phone (with active service) on which I had accumulated over 1800 minutes from repeated renewals every 3 months with a 60 minute card (+ double minutes).  I called Tracfone and used the automated system to transfer over my phone number, service time and minutes to this new ZTE phone -- a process that took less than 5 minutes.  A few hours later, everything was transferred over, and my new ZTE smartphone was fully functional with 3G capability for data.  As an unexpected bonus, the minutes that I transferred over were doubled by Tracfone, which came as a complete surprise to me.  So I ended up getting 3600+ talk minutes, 3600+ texts, and 3600+ MB of data, for my new phone.Yearly service cards from Tracfone cost around $85 and comes with 1200 minutes/texts/MB data (400 x 3), so you are looking at around $7 per month if you are sensible about the amount of usage that you put on the phone.  I refuse to pay the ridiculous amounts that regular cell carriers charge, so this Tracfone plan is perfect for me.  It's still hard for me to think that some people (who don't make that much in the first place) are paying anywhere from $500 to $1000 per year for their cell service, on top of the hundreds that they shelled out for their fancy phone.  And these people wonder why they never have any money left at the end of the month, and why they keep living from paycheck to paycheck.The phone itself has everything I need.  The speed and responsiveness of some apps leaves something to be desired at times, but for a $33 phone, I can definitely live with those drawbacks.  I recommend getting a 16gb microSD card for around $10, if you are going to download a lot of apps, as the 4gb card that comes with the phone will get filled up pretty fast.Overall, an excellent phone for the price.

Reviews.Title: ZTE Valet Android Prepaid Phone
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: This phone has been great. Not lots of memory but will be purchasing larger SIM card. No dropped calls and good call clarity. No problems with this phone. Great purchase for the price!!

Reviews.Title: great little android phone
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: great little android phone. no problems. smaller screen than others but no contract and works the same as expensive ones

Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone for the price
Reviews.Author: A Product Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Phone for the price. I've been with tracphone for over 10 years and this phone serves every purpose I have for a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: The most affordable entry level Android phone!
Reviews.Author: Ken J. Anton
Reviews.Content: The quality of the touch screen as well as phone reception is quite excellent. The Wi-Fi connection is very good. Will get another one soon.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: DebbyL115
Reviews.Content: We live in an area with poor reception and this phone works great. Easy to learn hoe to use. Take good pictures. Great phone for the money

Reviews.Title: Great Phone. A few glitches
Reviews.Author: GWEN Y.
Reviews.Content: Was a bit of a headache to port mu number due to my old phone company not having some number required to port it. Tracphone customer service was great in helping me out. They called my old company for me and did everything.... As far as the phone goes: GPS is fantastic! Cant receive picture msgs unless data is on, even when Im on wifi, alarm clock will not work- it's always set to silent no matter what I do. Just downloaded an alarm app. Internet is insanely slow so I never use it, I just use my tablet or pc. If youre looking at this phone to do a lot of browsing, def look elsewhere. Otherwise, simple interface, smooth touch response, overall great for what I need it for. Dont have too many apps on here - theyre all on my tablet

Reviews.Title: Tracfone ZTE Android Prepaid Phone w/ 600 minutes & triple refill minutes
Reviews.Author: Althea
Reviews.Content: I already own one of these phones. Great price. Durable for my needs. Came with 600 minutes. All future minutes added are tripled . This phone was purchased as a gift for a relative. I would recommend this android to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Joe Blankenship
Reviews.Content: I'm still getting used to it to be honest. But it was easy to set up to use with my home Wi-Fi. Once I learn how to use all of the features, I'm sure I will enjoy it even more.

Reviews.Title: zte
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Lew
Reviews.Content: so far so good!  kinda slow starting up but works great otherwise.  still learning to use it but seems simple enough.

Reviews.Title: New and works great
Reviews.Author: Erin "Dawn"
Reviews.Content: Android system, lots of Apps available. Saved about 40% over purchasing it through tracfone directly. Great smartphone option for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Wayne W. Kaipainen
Reviews.Content: It was delivered as promised, it worked and I got the bonus of 3 months and 600 minutes from tracfone. That was a good value.

Reviews.Title: newphone
Reviews.Author: dennis gorman
Reviews.Content: It is good phone  does what i want it too. Good deal for the price.Has alot of features.Have only had it a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: tyler dean francis
Reviews.Content: sure it can't match up to the quad core phones, but it runs great for what it costs, not to mention on tracfone you can pay 9.99 a month to keep it running, and the 3g speeds on it aren't that bad and are sometimes better than my home connection. Not to mention you're getting a 40 dollar minutes card with it. all in all, 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Second purchase with great service.
Reviews.Author: TeriC
Reviews.Content: The Tracfone androids seem like a quantum leap in usefulness and value for light to medium users.  This phone had a dead/stuck pixel in the center of display. I explained to the company and was immediately Priority Mailed a replacement. The only question was if I would like a refund or replacement. I could not ask for better service. A company that should be emulated.

Reviews.Title: wanted this phone scomce it came out...
Reviews.Author: j man
Reviews.Content: I know you should get the phone. I just got it and love it ! It is just like a smartphone

Reviews.Title: Great choice!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Phillips
Reviews.Content: bought this one only after reviewing all the smart phones Tracfone had to offer.  This one was the best priced and it came with 600 minutes! And it's like a min computer anywhere in my house or there is free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: Martin G. Petracca
Reviews.Content: Hi, had numerous smartphones, but this one works as good as any one that I had in the past! The tracfone triple minutes are spread out evenly. This phone is even cheaper to operate that net10, or straight talk, or virgin mobile. The phone is NOT SLOW!!! Martin

Reviews.Title: Runs Android version with Heartbleed security bug.
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Runs Android version 4.1.1 which contains a major security flaw (Heartbleed bug). According to Tracfone forum, they are not going to update the operating system in order to fix the bug. The bug can lead to having your private information stolen, so I cannot recommend purchasing this phone.

Reviews.Title: Must read! Important information that may save your family lot of money
Reviews.Author: Y. Davis
Reviews.Content: My husband has AT&T; Smartphone with contract requirements. His bill averaged $110+ a month because of data, Text messages, Photos Text to him. I use tracfone myself and stretch my minutes to last months. I am pleased with not having a cellphone bill. I loved his smartphone but just didn't want another contract. I also have three teens without regular cellphones. They were using old andriod phones given to them to use in Wifi. I learned you don't need a phone turned on to use the wifi on android phones. In wifi you can use magic jack app to call, text-free app to text, and search the web all day long with no bill, At home we have wifi and at the kids school they do. The kids are home majority of the time. So they can get calls and texts whenever they want. It saves me a lot on cell phone bills.Then I found this phone. We can use wifi 90% of the time. Then the rest of the time use tracfone minutes when were out.1. First phone puchased was for my husband uses this phone to search the web, netflix, police scanners(his hobby), Pandora, reads emails,radio stations, youtube videos all with apps gotten for free with the play store. Now he does't have to worry about data. He has been able to downgrade his date usage on At&T; phone (since he uses his tracfone). His bill went down to $55 a month with AT&T.; He loves this ZTE phone. He hasn't even added the Prepaid phone minutes to his phone. He started using it right out of  the box.2. Second phone is for me and started using it also without adding the minutes yet. I forgot to mention that there is a way to turn off the data so that you know your using Wifi only. So that you can save data minutes for when you need them. I can have my coupon checkout 51, Target Cartwheel, ebay apps all for free. It been a month now and still haven't needed to add the phone card yet. I purchased the Miniturtle Premium Rugged Shell Hybrid Protective Phone Case Cover for about $10. Money well spent.I plan to purchase more of these phones for the kids. My teenager rated the back camera as average. There is no front facing camera, It does come with a 4GB micro SD card. I highly recommend this phone and the case mentioned above. The case also comes with screen protector.

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: bck0825
Reviews.Content: Does a lot. Almost like a mini tablet.worth the money.tracfne sells for $20 more without minutes.very satisfied so far with it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have had tracfones for a few years now for two reasons.  The first is that where our house is located doesn't always get the best reception with anyone carrier in our area and the second is that we hated getting locked into a contract every month for a minimum of a year.That being said I actually purchased 2 of these phones one for me and one for my husband as our other phones were getting old and just needed to be upgraded.  We love these phones!  We know they aren't the newest and best out there but, then again the newest and greatest don't typically hold that title for long anyway.  These phones do way more than we ever thought we could do on a phone.  Basically it is a small tablet so you can pretty much do anything but, type a document.  The best part about them though is that they keep our kids quiet and occupied when they are bored.  If we had known that we would have purchased them sooner....lol.  No regrets what so ever.

Reviews.Title: ZTE Android Phone great for the price
Reviews.Author: Cane
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this phone to anyone that wants a smartphone and cannot afford the huge data plans that go along with them on cell plans. This phone has a lot of great features and if you are disciplined with using wifi then tracphone is a great alternative

Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone
Reviews.Author: George Uebler
Reviews.Content: I also have a Samsung Note 2. I like the Valet because it is smaller and the battery life is days not one day. The jellybean software is simple to use and similar to the latest that came with the Note. Very pleased with the phone. The internet is fast on the phone and with triple the minutes,data, and text is all I need for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: As a TracFone customer this is a GREAT phone!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Sure, its no Samsung Galaxy S5 but as far as TracPhone goes, this is a pretty good bang for your buck. The only con I can see is its wifi radius which isn't very far, but thats only a minor issue. I love the phone! Its nice to actually have a smartphone that doesn't cost a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: ZTE Valet
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone a month ago and so far have not had any problems with it. Except the wireless is a little weak. It's great at home but has some troubles out in the real world.It doesn't display your minutes but there's an app that will do that so no problem there.I like the phone.Good phone as a first smart phone

Reviews.Title: too many problems with programing, etc.
Reviews.Author: Gail R. Livingston
Reviews.Content: It took a lot of time and confusion with Tracfone to get it working. About 2 weeks ago when I tried to get another app installed, a weird voice took over my phone and I got locked out of the phone, unable to call anyone or use any apps or even turn it off! I sent an email to you trying to exchange the phone, but the vendor refused to take it back. I only had it a little over a month. I called tracfone for help ,but they could not help me after 3 hrs. Of trying.  So when the vendor wouldn't help l called tracfone again and spent 2 more hrs. Trying to get rid of the voice invasion, Tracfone was kind enough to offer to take it back and send me another phone. However I am still waiting to get it. They sent me return instructions so I FED-Zed it last Thursday.  Meanwhile I have been without a cell phone for 10 days.

Reviews.Title: Nice Item!
Reviews.Author: Crystal Carver
Reviews.Content: Great deal! Will consider for future purchases, saving money daily as we speak  !!! Thank you for the deal! !

Reviews.Title: Can't recommend
Reviews.Author: Rich H
Reviews.Content: It was great having my first Android phone, although not a great one. But the unreceptive screen and the need to restart by r & r the battery was a little annoying. I chose the ZTE because the  Samsung seemed outdated. After 3 months it has seeming died, it won't get past the Tracfone screen no matter how long I leave out the battery, etc. I sent an email to ZTE support but got no reply. I then went to the -new- LG39c and like it very much. The screen is responsive and it picks up wifi far better than the ZTE. The LG lacks a flash light but isn't a big deal to me.

Reviews.Title: ZTE
Reviews.Author: lpetra
Reviews.Content: What's not to like about this phone, it's android, you have google apps, and triple minutes, a camera, enough said.

Reviews.Title: for the $, it is INCREDIBLE...
Reviews.Author: Vandelay Industries
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone at Best Buy for $49.99 +tax about a week agoThe ONLY reason I bought this phone was because I wanted to be able to take pictures of my paycheck and deposit it into my account without going to the bank.  My bank is over 20 miles away, so going out there every week is a huge pain.  You need an Andriod phone to do this.  The "smartphone" craze has been a huge turn-off for me.  I have always had more to do with my time than stare at a 3.5" screen.  However, like the Chase mobile app I needed, it is becoming almost necessary to own one nowadays.I actually purchased a Samsung Centura Tracfone but returned it because I found this.  The Centura new is $129.99, more than TWICE the price of this phone.  I do not see how ANYONE would pay an extra $70 for it.  This phone's operating system is actually  one level up from the Centura!  The only thing the Centura has over the Valet that I can see is a front-facing camera for Skype, but thats not worth $70, is it?Having said that, even the Centura is a VERY GOOD value compared to the high-end Andriods.I had an LG840 Tracfone before this.  The fact that this phone is only $10 more than the LG840 (the 840 was right next to the Valet on the shelf) is MIND BOGGLING!THE BADThe touch screen is frustrating but, like another reviewer stated, hopefully I will get better at it myself.  This is my 1st Android phone but certainly not my first touchscreen device.  Besides the cool vibrations I would rank it near the bottom.  This is the reason the phone does not get 5 stars because it has actually been a rather large annoyance for me so far.The fact that the phone itself does not display your prepaid balance is a moot point thanks to the free app, so anyone who discounts the Valet or Centura for this is pretty dense.My girlfriend has the LG800DHL and we will be getting her one of these this weekend.  It is a no brainer for anyone's first Android.

Reviews.Title: Will not wake up sometimes
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: There is a glitch on this phone that appears to be common upon researching the web after it has happened to me several times. Sometimes the phone will not wake up with the top button. Totally unresponsive. The battery has to be removed for 10 seconds and then it will reboot. Other than this the phone is a good value.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: John Pratt
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone a few weeks ago and love it.I have used the wifi at my home and office with no problems. It is almost as fast as my google nexus tablet. I notice that when I am driving around, it chimes and detects available wifi. It is not a top of the line smartphone but for 60 bucks it is a great deal.It is on verizon network and it is clearer on calls than my old tracfone which was on at&t.; Texting works great. I would highly recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: ZTE Valet Phone
Reviews.Author: Linda J. Eddy
Reviews.Content: I do so love this phone!  This my first touch screene and that was hard to get use to, but bought  some stylus that took care of it . It has the same 4Gs as my netbook. and does all it does in a more portable device.  and makes calls. Ilike that i can customize it to my liking.  The only thing i have negative to say is that it should come stock with facebook and twitter apps. Would and have recomend this phone .

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: amazon junkie
Reviews.Content: It is a smart phone that is a really good deal!  I love the price I paid and the 600 minutes that came with it!  I read a lot of reviews on this before buying it so I do want to comment on wi-fi.  I have never had a problem connecting to wi-fi with this phone.  As a matter of fact, I keep it on wi-fi most of the time and very rarely use data.  I do want to mention that I have noticed that in order to send text messages with pic or video attachments I have to switch on the data though but I switch it right back off after sending.  I have no problems with any apps or anything else that I can think of.

Reviews.Title: Phone functions ok
Reviews.Author: Kerry J Johnson
Reviews.Content: Phone does the job and only cost $60It is a good starter phone.Wifi connectivity is bad, but works.Other phone features work well.

Reviews.Title: Good feature set, disappointing performance.
Reviews.Author: rpridenh
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone because i was very excited to see that Tracfone finally offered smart phones. I made the purchase through an independent dealer. The price and bundle offer was great. Reviews of the phone were good. I like that it has a decent camera, Android OS, a 1GHz processor, an SD card slot and WiFi. The fact that it uses the CDMA protocol is also a plus in my region.Unlike other writers, I like Tracfone's new refill plan for smartphones. When you buy and airtime card you, say a 60 minute card, you get 60 minutes of talk time, 60 text messages, and 60 MB of data. Yes, they charge you a whole unit for a text, but the way I see it I'm getting the texts ON TOP OF the talk time, whereas before texts came from the same 60 minute pool but cost 1/3 of a unit per message. What's more is that this phone gets triple minutes, so the 6o unit card gets 180 minutes of talk, 180 texts, and 180 MB of data. Works great for me.However, the issues I've had with the phone just added up to overall disappointment.Firstly, the first phone I received had a defective touch screen. No problem, both Tracfone and the dealer ShopCellDeals were great at replacing the defective phone.Next, everything technically "worked" on the replacement phone, but performance was lacking. The response of the touch screen is choppy and inconsistent. Seems like it's hard to activate the function you want, but easy to accidentally get the one DON'T want. Scrolling and swipe action is not smooth.Apps seem to load very slowly, i.e., around 10 seconds, despite the seemingly fast processor.The speakerphone feature is not loud enough to be useful except in a quiet room, certainly not in a car, even when parked.Lastly, and this was the deal-breaker for me, is that the WiFi radio is extremely weak. At home I lose the wifi signal at a mere 10 to 12 feet away. By comparison, my 3rd generation iPod touch can still get a signal at 15 to 20 feet. I specifically wanted a phone with WiFi. This was a let down. If I have to be  no more than 5 to 10 feet from the router to get it, i might as well have a wire.Perhaps I'm asking too much for an "entry level" smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Valet
Reviews.Author: Hmc3
Reviews.Content: HiThese are our first smart phones so far very happy with them . We like the fact that there is no contracts involved and since it backed on Verizon it has good reception . We do not make a lot of calls ,texts and mostly use wi fi instead of data, its a plus you get unlimited carry over on all 3. For the basic smart phone I think it moves fairly quickly

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: M.
Reviews.Content: This phone works fairly well. It can't run any apps that are too advanced and it does freeze on occasion, but for the price and free minutes that come with the phone, if you want a TracFone, I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: zte
Reviews.Author: brenda smith
Reviews.Content: still getting use to it. I seem to hit the camara button alot of times when I don't mean to. I can not get my e-mail to work. Wish the volume would go up a little bit more. I love the size and shape.

Reviews.Title: ITS GREAT FOR A 13 YEAR OLD.  VERRY HAPPY!!!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Oliver
Reviews.Content: Love it for the 13 yr old its not an iphon but when it gets dropped or stolen  I Will not be having the break down. I love it and she dose too.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PHONE FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: fmaz
Reviews.Content: Very good phone for the price, an android phone with tracphone if a good for what I use it for, easy set up and to get 600 minutes was a good value

Reviews.Title: everyone should have this phone
Reviews.Author: Bounphengphongsavath
Reviews.Content: I love itit is not that fast but it works everything worksto it the Tracfone service is also a very good and the phone is very good also and last a long time for battery life

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: Elsabe Buell
Reviews.Content: It is definitely an upgrade from my old traction, and the minutes last for a long time. However, I.cannot get reception in buildings where other phones can, nor on the road. The speaker is not great.  When I call people, they can hardly hear me with the static. Just contacted the seller to see if they can help me.

Reviews.Title: zte
Reviews.Author: Donald B.
Reviews.Content: zte valet for me is bad luck, first phone no signal sent back, 2nd no signal sent back, working on my third phone, hope they send one that works.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: Haven't had this particular phone long, am still getting used to how it works. So far it does a good job and I will recommend it. Only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because I am not totally comfortable with it, when I am I will give it a 5, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: Phone Zte
Reviews.Author: D Murray
Reviews.Content: This is a great little phone. For the price I wasn't expecting a lot but was greatly surprised. I texted and  called on my old phone which wasgreat for my purposes but since I bought this phone I go on line to check email, weather, and orders while on the road. I really like the capability of sending a picture of what I'm looking at, rather than trying to explain over the phone, what something looks like that I think might work in a given situation. Overall a great phone for the time I have had it and am still discovering other functions. For a less expensive option this is a great android phone.

Reviews.Title: Loved the phone but had its flaws
Reviews.Author: TINA C.
Reviews.Content: I have wanted a smart phone for a while and was pleased when Tracfone started carrying them.  Ordered phone, got it, could not transfer current number, other functions on phone failed to work, very disappointed.  Returned phone (buyer was great and sent refund) and I went back to my old phone.

Reviews.Title: long battery life, some poor software design
Reviews.Author: samuel
Reviews.Content: the battery can last up to nearly two weeks on just standby, right now my phone battery is at 33% and it says it has not been plugged in to a charger in over nine days, i have spent about 40 minutes using it for calls texts and emails in those days. i live in a basement and i only get about three of the five or six bars of reception.  the onscreen dialpad on my phone does not work with the phone to ear sensor which is probabally just a flaw in the software, so when i need to use the dialpad and listen such as with voice mail and other automated stuff my ear starts touching the dialpad and screws up my call, so i am forced to use speakerphone or severly tilt the screen away from my face. when the dialpad is turned off then the sensor works and turns the screen off everytime i put the phone to my ear and back on when i take it away.  the volume of the speaker on my phone doesn't go any lower than a loud setting so i have to keep my ear a little away from the phone even on the lowest volume.  the speach to text works well on emails as well as texting even if i speak fairly fast and indistinctly.

Reviews.Title: Entry level Android
Reviews.Author: TestTech7.ETS
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my oldest grandson as a reward for being a great kid.  He's 11 years old and had taken very good care of his first cellphone which is a very basic phone.  This phone works on the Verizon network and has a very good signal in our area. It's not the latest, greatest, or the fastest, but it seems to work very well.If you are looking for a smart Tracfone that just works for a minimal price, this is it.

Reviews.Title: after having phone activated.
Reviews.Author: ray hanus
Reviews.Content: the phone did not have the 600 minutes with it, had to buy additional minutes in order to have the phonephone turned on, did i read this wrong or does it read with 600 minutes.Ray Hanus

Reviews.Title: Difficult to operate.
Reviews.Author: Stanley L.
Reviews.Content: I had to return this phone as not only was the operation difficult but there was no proper Operational Manual to help me operate it properly.

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Gerald Corbett
Reviews.Content: As advertised, it is a great phone for the price. It sure beats having a contract phone especially if finances are tight.

Reviews.Title: ZTE Valet Android Prepaid Phone with 600 Minutes and Triple Minutes...
Reviews.Author: Fehsinger
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart phone. I love it and highly recommend it.My wife purchased this exact phone several weeks before I did and is quite happy with it. After playing with her's I decided to get one of my own. The phone has good reception and works well in our rural area where reception can be spotty. I also like the fact that with TracFones there are no contracts. The triple minutes are an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: Bad wifi
Reviews.Author: Kendall E. Fader "Tatoonie"
Reviews.Content: I like the phone, but I bought it for the wifi . It can't see the router 60 ft away

Reviews.Title: no room to complain
Reviews.Author: littledummy
Reviews.Content: For the price there is no way to complain about anything. This is an entry level android phone for a great price.

Reviews.Title: great phone for the price
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I don't think you can get much better for the price.  I haven't used much data because I use the wifi and that doesn't costanything.  This is my first smart phone and  I really have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Insane value and a great phone.
Reviews.Author: Kerry S
Reviews.Content: Bought this to upgrade from a LG 800G and this thing is amazing for the price.  Getting 600 worth of talk/text/data + the phone for $65 is just incredible and the phone runs pretty damn smooth as well.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Douglas Whisler
Reviews.Content: Love the phone, It is a entry level android phone, Takes nice pictures but camera is not good for scanner apps( my biggest grip)As long as you don't expect it to be like the latest and greatest it does the job well It is set up nice and I had no need to download a bunch of useless apps.

Reviews.Title: Beware of tracfone service
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: I like this phone. The only problem with it is I can't switch over to straight talk service. Minutes really blow. And their yearly plans are a big rip-off. My research was flawed. This is the right phone but tracfone service sucks. Shipped right on time.

Reviews.Title: Lags so much...
Reviews.Author: Roger Villanueva
Reviews.Content: I had mine for a few months now since then, there has been so many issues. What really disappointed me most is how my micro sd was "removed" even though it's still in the phone (Nothing wrong with my sd btw.) It's better to use a standard micro sd not an ultra type which I was using. The apps I downloaded do somewhat work depending what you get. It's better if the apps stay on the phones internal storage than moving it to the sd storage, they don't show or start after the phones powered on. They will eventually show but not always and often fail to run. I was also unsatisfied of the available ram it has. Instead of the stated 512mb there's only 386mb total not only that, after I set up my device there was less than 50mb free. Even after I closed running apps there's still not much available. For what I know of course less ram is less speed. At least Tracfone's service is alright, making calls & texting works good enough so I cant complain too much. I hope Tracfone has much better androids soon.

Reviews.Title: Good "Fone"... but wait!
Reviews.Author: Whisper
Reviews.Content: This Tracfone runs Android 4.1.1 which is known to be vulnerable to the Heartbleed bug.I was  advised by the Android people to have my carrier upgrade to a later Version to avoidthis problem. Unfortunately, Tracfone has no info on their Site about any upgrade-but their user forum has hundreds of complaints about this issue.But when you register and lodge another request you are told (by private message)to call Tracfone Customer service. Customer service says a fix will be sent to the phone by "Android"or by the  Manufacturer ZTE- but they dont know who or when. When you call ZTE they say they dont support Tracfones but they give you a number to call Tracfone!So while it is a  pretty good phone- it's not worth the risk of getting infected with a nasty bug so easily.But I guess you can keep it off the internet and use it as a dumb phone.Shame on Tracfone for letting it's loyal users down like this.

Reviews.Title: Screaming Deal on a Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Peter Adrian
Reviews.Content: I don't have too much to add to what others have written, but I am quite pleased with my new ZTE Valet. The Android 4.1.1 OS worked fine right out of the box; calls and text messages go right through; settings are accessible and easy to use; data and wi-fi are easy to switch on and off. My airtime transferred without a hitch. Onboard storage is sufficient for my needs, and there is a way to store apps on the microSD card. Google it if you want, as it is a rather involved procedure involving a PC and external programs. The only real glitch I had was getting to my voicemail. The number didn't carry over when I transferred my contacts from my old phone via the SD card, but a quick web search led me to the answer. All in all, I think this is one of the better smartphone deals going.

Reviews.Title: THIS PHONE SUCKETH!!!
Reviews.Author: Ms Khan
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE! WASTE OF TIME AND WASTE OF MONEY! If I could give it a 0 I would!I thought I would take a chance on this phone since the reviews were mixed.  However it only lasted a week, even prior to the screen refusing to turn on it was a total crap phone.  The camera takes 2 - 3 mins to turn on, so even if it does decide to turn on there are no spontaneous pics.  I bought this phone because I missed the apps I had on my old ATT phone, even though I did not miss their bill.What a piece of crap!!! Can't open the starbucks app in the time it takes to stand in line.  Can't open the camera quickly, even if you do finally get it open it takes THE WORST PICTURES EVER!  Totally grainy and loowww resolution.1092191860 ticket #

Reviews.Title: Great value - great phone
Reviews.Author: J. Norgaard
Reviews.Content: great starter android phone / run every app my kids put on it - good call quality. Use Goigle Voice app and turn off wireless data for free unlimited texting and boice calls too when on a wifi connection

Reviews.Title: Phone works OK, but the company is deceptive in their advertising
Reviews.Author: Satisfied Solderer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone and it has worked adequately. The problem arises in trying to deal with the company's advertising.Their web site advertises plans and offers bonus minutes for some of them. ...Imagine my surprise when I bought one of these offers and they refused me my bonus minutes all together because and I quote here their email ... "Please be informed that promo codes are not applicable to Android phones."... My goodness do they really sell anything else BUT android phones?Moreover, they cannot point to any link on their website where this is explained, where the consumer can be informed prior to purchase, and then they just fold their arms and say all promo purchases are final and they will not refund my money. ... All this less than 1 hour after my purchase, after I have not used the phone at all, they refuse to back out the transaction. This is simply not a reasonable way to do business. I now have to cancel out this credit card transaction. Not good. Not good at all.I regret buying this phone, and I cannot in good conscience recommend any product offered by them. To say I am annoyed is a massive understatement.UPDATE: Now they call me a couple of days later and say that they have updated their website to reflect that they do not offer bonus minutes on Androids. I say fine, but give me my money back and they still refuse. They insist that I have to cancel the payment through my credit card if I hope to get my money back. Clearly they are in error as evidenced by their need to change their web site after my order, but unfortunately they are not honorable enough to refund a purchase that was made as a result of their ad, an ad that they now admit was deceptive because they had to change it. Not Good, Not Good at all.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: John Plunkett
Reviews.Content: Looked like a great deal and initially was pleased with the features and functioning of this phone.  In setting phone up, was disappointed that I couldn't transfer my previous Tracfone number...no big deal, but certainly something of an irritation.  Phone worked fine for about 10 days...then the screen went blank/black.  Eventually figured out from online forums, that if I took out the battery for an extended time (10-15 minutes)....it would come back.  Worked for a few days...then it got to where it couldn't make or receive phone calls (wifi was still working fine).  Spent ~2-3 hours with Tracfone customer service....to no avail.  Have returned phone to Amazon/shopcelldeals.  Very wary of this brand (Huawei) at this point.  Hoping that Tracfone will eventually bring some mid-range level smartphones to their product line as I very much like their 'pay as you go' model.  Wouldn't recommend the Huawei brand at this point.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: pablo rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Worst of the worst, pure junk, slower than a snail do not buy this is terrible, do not waste your money

Reviews.Title: This product failed to operate, right out of the box.
Reviews.Author: Richard Curley
Reviews.Content: The touch screen icons responded to touch sporadically. The phone icon did not respond to any touch. I do not want a replacement of this product. I want a full refund.

ProductInfo.Features:
Android Phone for Tracfone Service
Triple Minutes for Life; Separate Balance for Minutes, Texts and Data (Example:  Add 200 Minutes and Receive 600 Minutes and 600 Texts and 600 MB of Data)
Includes 600 Minutes, 600 Texts and 600 MB of Data (minutes already tripled)
Android 4.1
3.5" Touchscreen
ProductInfo.Name: ZTE Valet Android Prepaid Phone with 600 Minutes and Triple Minutes (Tracfone)
